## NHANCE data introduction

You need to use some public available dataset to support the final project analysis. [NHANCE data](https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/) is a rich nation-wide questionnaire data provided by the CDC. If you choose to use the NHANCE data, some data processing need to be done. Here is a [[toy example](rcode/week2/ReadNHANCEData.html)] for downloading and processing the [2015-2016 data](https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/continuousnhanes/default.aspx?BeginYear=2015). For your own analysis, you may want to consider the more recent [2017-2018 data](https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/continuousnhanes/default.aspx?BeginYear=2017). Additional source and data files:

  * `.Rmd` [`r xfun::embed_file('docs/rcode/week2/ReadNHANCEData.Rmd', text = 'Source File')`]
  * Data Files (from NHANES 2015-2016)
      + Demographic data: [DEMO_I.XPT](https://wwwn.cdc.gov/Nchs/Nhanes/2015-2016/DEMO_I.XPT)
      + Diabetes data: [DIQ_I.XPT](https://wwwn.cdc.gov/Nchs/Nhanes/2015-2016/DIQ_I.XPT)
      + Examination data: [BMX_I.XPT](https://wwwn.cdc.gov/Nchs/Nhanes/2015-2016/BMX_I.XPT)
